results.title: Computer: tool for the future
results.creator_credit: Sidney Platt, National Geographic Society and Yves Gerard Issembert
results.brief_description: A look at the history of tools such as the abacus, adding machines and computers, the recent developments in computer technology and how computers are used to manage information and various applications of computers today. Also mentions some of the concerns that computerization raises.

results.title: Computer revolution. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, James Jackson and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A timely - even frightening - reminder of the rapid advance computers are making into our lives. In many fields the impersonal efficient machine is shaping and controlling our destinies. The film points to the ever-increasing reliance on computers and illustrates computer applications of today and in the future specifically in production, aviation, medicine, education, law-enforcement, rocket space travel, design, communication etc. Implications for citizens’ rights to privacy. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Computer history digest: a chronicle of important events...
results.creator_credit: George Samson and Association for computing machinery
results.brief_description: Provides a brief historical overview of computers, with a focus on US achievements. Discusses punch card technology and the flexibility of plug boards. Shows the 1939 Worlds Fair showcasing future calculating devices and the ENIAC, designed by Eckert and Mauchly to compute World War II ballistic firing tables. Includes early 20th century footage of computers.

results.title: Computer Graphics Special
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey de Valois, Donna Cohen and Steve Michelson
results.brief_description: Journey to the unknown as this thoroughly entertaining program takes you on a behind the scenes journey into the exciting world of computer graphics and animation. Travel from inside the body to outer space; as the worlds of fantasy and reality explode in a colour and intensity never seen before.

results.title: Computer games
results.brief_description: ‘Computer games’ is a light-hearted drama about clashing personalities and computer crime in the corporate world. The director’s intention was to create a good, fun, entertaining film with a number of twists and surprises. The setting of the film is a high technology office environment where employee Raymond Edwards (David Whiteley) has one basic problem. For many years he has endured the company of Tony Simmons, a naive and aggravating workmate. Raymond’s experience is one to which many people can relate. He is frustrated by the constant annoying presence of a workmate who has followed him like a shadow through his career. Desperate to prevent Tony being considered for a promotion, Raymond frames him for embezzlement.

results.title: Comput-her baby
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Dave Goldson and Neal Chastain
results.brief_description: A humorous but pointed satire on computer dating. Accompanied by ironically contrasting musical background, human voices reveal personal statistics for consumption by the computer. Compares cybernetic matching and old-fashioned computers, and questions the relationship between people and computers.

results.title: Compulsive car thief
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson Associates and Robert Anderson
results.brief_description: Presents the case history of a 21-year-old prison inmate who has been stealing cars and getting caught since he was 10 years old, pointing out that his behaviour has continued to baffle his parents, and the court. Poses the question: is the psychopath a medical or legal problem?

results.title: Comptes a Rebours = Reckoning Against the Grain
results.brief_description:
Nolan was set up to take the fall for a crime committed by his whole gang. As a result, his brother is dead and he is forced to do a stint in prison. Nolan comes out of prison looking for his former accomplice, and not just to shake their hands. He runs into an old girlfriend, Madeleine, now a respectable doctor’s wife.

Credits: Producer, Eugene Lepicier ; director, Roger Pigaut ; writers, Andre G. Brunelin, Roger Pigaut ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Serge Reggiani, Jeanne Moreau, Michel Bouquet, Simone Signoret, Marcel Bozzuffi, Charles Vanel.

results.title: Compound interest
results.creator_credit: Frank Wilson, Timothy Swartz, Instructional Media, Penn State and WPSX-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Principles of accounting”.
Thomas Casey demonstrates how compound interest increases the time value of money. Present value and future value are explained, and how to compute simple and compound interest, which may involve the use of specially designed tables. The program concludes by showing how interest rates can be stated and how to calculate investment for the future.
